page.title: 01Dairy Villages of the Stour
page.content: Entirely within the Blackmore Vale, this is a gently undulating rural region of established agriculture. hedgerows border small fields where dairy farming predominates. Recently the ecology has been vastly altered by Dutch elm disease. Fox, badger, deer, rabit, hare and bird abound. The unnavigable river stour meanders through the region and the A30 crosses it. narrow lanes link stour provost, population 504; Fifehead Magdalen, population 93; West Stour population 133 and Kington Magna population 341. Census figures 1981. In these villages stone buildins of varying ages cluster around aged churches. Most of the area lacks mains drainage. Thee is no industry but permanent unemployment is low. Apart from the farms it is residential but numerous crafts are procteced and services
